reviews.review_msg: Valerie is very understanding and fair. If you want to go into law enforcement, take this class as she is a sergeant for the VPD. She provides unique examples and personal experiences that are beneficial to the learner. Would highly recommend and would definitely take another class with her again.

My favorite professor at SFU. She makes boring topics interesting, is really funny, and makes the exams super easy. She explicitly said in the beginning of the semester that it's an easy class and you'll have to try HARD to fail. The class' average on the midterm was an A-

Martin was a decent prof. I did find that his course structure can be confusing at times based on what he asks for on assignments. Nonetheless, he always respond fast to emails, which is good. His lecture slides were helpful and can contribute to most of what you need to know. Exam question can straight from textbook.

If you are a student with high value for organized and timely guidelines for assignments, clear slides and lecture style, and a professor that carries their weight/responsibilities... this is NOT the guy for you. He's not only a rambler but also... all over the place.
One of the best profs I've had at SFU. Knowledgeable, friendly, concise lectures, and clear guidelines. Definitely recommend.
She only reads her notes on class, and her notes are copied exactly word by word from textbook. You don't need to go to class.
She's awesome. Super chill class only consisted of a midterm, paper, final and participation marks.
